abstracts.cdata!:
The Argentina Forestry Development
            Project has a satisfactory outcome, is likely to be
            sustained, and has a substantial institutional development
            impact. Bank and Borrower performances were satisfactory.
            Several lessons were cited, which touched on the following
            topics: basing project design on a comprehensive sector
            review; the influence of macroeconomic environment;
            government support; the links between the project and the
            forestry directorate; the ownership of institutional reform;
            using information and data for planning purposes; the
            approach of carrying out applied research; the approach for
            carrying out the small farmer component; the approach for
            carrying out research; the sustainability of extension
            services (the Forestry Extension Node); monitoring and
            evaluation; the project implementation arrangement;
            strengthening the provincial staff; and the design of indicators.
